Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 08:47AM shengyue527 wrote: Hi Luann, Hope i can give you some useful info about the ringworm on your feet. because all of you have helped me a lot about my mum's bc mets liver and i really want to do something for you. 3 or 4 yrs ago i also got problem with my feet and i have tried all the creams i can get from uk and China. Nothing works on me. Once i went back to China on holiday, my aunt told me Glacial Acetic Acid works on feet problem very well. i bought a bottle of Glacial Acetic Acid from a chemic shop in China, diluted it to 15% with warm water and soaked my feet till the water turned cold. i soaked my feet for 3 days then started using cotton bud to put 30%Glacial Acetic Acid on my feet morning and evening. it takes one or two weeks to see the result, it's amazing, it's totally gone and last yr the problem recurred but not as bad as before, so i used 30% again, it's gone again. so far so good, i have my healthy feet. I don't know where u can get Glacial Acetic Acid from in US, but i think it's worth to try it. :) yue

Posts.Content: shengyue527 wrote: Hi, it's Yue here, since my mom started her chemo, I found some chinese medical tips can help her with the side effects of chemos, i list them here, hopeful they can help you or your family. a)Tongue During/after the chemo, most ppl got problems with their tongues(thick,white), that's because the chemo produces heat in your liver. Loach(fish) is best for reducing the heat in liver. My mom told me she can get loach in fishing shops in China because normally ppl use it as bait when they go fishing. Cooking method: get fresh loach meat and mince it, mix a bit salt and/or pepper. shape the mince like little meatballs and eat it raw, it's just like sushi, taste ok nothing horrible at all.  One loach each day. my mom only need two days to cure her tongue. b)Cold body or cold hand and feet, also good for tiredness Chemos treatments can exhaust your body energy. After reduce the heat of your liver, you can start to warm your body. red dates and fresh ginger are the best and the easiest you can get them anywhere in the world( you can buy dried dates from any chinese supermarkets) Cut some ginger into slices and boil with dates, about 20 mins. Drink it everyday, if you like it tastes sweet, put some unrefined cane sugar, you will get your energy back much quicker. Moxa is the best plant for blood circulation. I saw some ppl are suffering from cold feet. So if you can find Moxa in your country, put some moxa leaves in while you soaking your feet. c) Good foods and bad foods for chemo ppl After chemos, your body is really weak. As a chinese we believe everything u eat can affect your condition, as western ppl prefer nutrition we have our own way to divide them. The nature of the food is cold or warm. chemo ppl should eat the warm food and avoid the cold food. Warm food fruits: peach, apricot, dates, lemon, coconut juice vegs:  onion, spring onion, coriander, garlic, pumpkin, ginger Meats: chicken, lamb and pork fishes: eel(yellow eel is the best one) Milk and egg are warm as well Cold food Fruits: sharon fruit, grape fruit, banana, watermelon, kiwi fruit vegs:  bitter melon meats: duck, hare, frog, snail, duck eggs Most seafoods are cold so if you really want some seafood, you can mix them with onion/spring onion and ginger.  Some other common foods such as apple, pear,pineapple, grapes, tunips, yam... most of them are in the middle, not too cold, not too warm, so you can eat them, just try to eat more warm food. :) And better not eat vegs in raw like salad, make it hot, steam, roast or whatever. d)Nausea In China, we can get some chinese herbal medicine after chemo to reduce the anorexia, nausea and vomitting, but i know it might be difficult to u understand it. but there is a easy way i can explain to you. Ginger, tangerine skin and honey fresh ginger(DONOT peel the skin) 20g, fresh tangerine skin 250g, honey 100g cut ginger into small pieces, add some warm water then pound it, get the ginger juice, put honey in, stir it. Then cut the tangerine skin into small slices, put them into ginger and honey juice, preserve for about one week, then it's ready for chemo nausea. When you feel nausea, try some preserved tangerine skin slices, if you like it, eat 3 times a day, each time about 20g is ok. :)  Dx 9/21/2006, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 6/12 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Some chiese medical tips for ppl suffer chemo treatments shengyue527 shengyue527

So highly recommend my chinese tips, my mom loves the loach meat balls, she started to take loach meatballs a few days before chemo and during the chemo, it works dramatically. Ladies, it's worth to try these tips.

Posts.Content: shengyue527 wrote: Just saw some information about Actonel, it says: Actonel (AK-tuh-nel) A drug that builds bones strength. It works by increasing the activity of the cells that make new bone. It is used to treat osteoporosis. It is also being studied for: reducing the risk of bone pain caused by cancer that has spread to the bone, and treating hypercalcemia (when calcium levels in the blood are too high).It belongs to the group of drugs called bisphosphonates. I am wondering if i can get some for my mom, she has bc mets liver and maybe bones, because she has pain on her shoulders, back and hips.  Don't know if it can help reducing the bones pain. please give me some suggestions, thx Dx 9/21/2006, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 6/12 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
